001package src.pkg_commands;
002import src.pkg_models.Player;
003import src.pkg_game.GameEngine;
004
005
006/**
007 * FireCommand class is a command that allows the player to fire the beamer.
008 * 
009 * @author Pierre MATAR
010 */
011public class FireCommand extends Command
012{
013     /**
014     * Executes the "fire" command for the player.
015     * It checks whether the player owns the beamer, whether the beamer is charged,
016     * and whether the player is in the correct room to fire the beamer.
017     *
018     * @param pPlayer the player who issued the command
019     * @param pGameEngine the game engine that controls the game state
020     */
021    
022    @Override
023    public void execute(final Player pPlayer, final GameEngine pGameEngine) {
024         if (!super.hasSecondWord()) {
025             pGameEngine.getGui().println("fire what ?");  
026             return;
027         }  
028        
029        String vBeamerName = super.getSecondWord();
030
031        if (!vBeamerName.equals(pPlayer.getBeamer().getName())) pGameEngine.getGui().println(vBeamerName + " is not the beamer");
032        else if (pPlayer.getItem(pPlayer.getBeamer().getName()) == null) pGameEngine.getGui().println("You don't own the beamer");
033        else if (!pPlayer.getBeamer().isBeamerCharged()) pGameEngine.getGui().println("You forget to charge the beamer !");
034        else {
035            if (pPlayer.getCurrentRoom() == pPlayer.getBeamerRoom()) {
036                pGameEngine.getGui().println("You can not fire at the same room you charged the beamer...");
037                return;
038            }
039            pPlayer.setCurrentRoom(pPlayer.getBeamerRoom());
040            pPlayer.addRoom(pPlayer.getCurrentRoom());
041            pGameEngine.printLocationInfo();
042            pPlayer.removeItem(vBeamerName);
043        }
044    }
045}
